t: Behold,*p thou art fair, my love; behold, thou art fair; thou hast doves' eyes within thy locks: thy hair is as a flock of goats, that appear from mount Gilead.
Thy*p teeth are like a flock of sheep that are even shorn, which came up from the washing; whereof every one bear twins, and none is barren among them.
Thy*p lips are like a thread of scarlet, and thy speech is comely: thy temples are like a piece of a pomegranate within thy locks.
Thy*p neck is like the tower of David builded for an armoury, whereon there hang a thousand bucklers, all shields of mighty men.
Thy*p two breasts are like two young roes that are twins, which feed among the lilies.
Until*p the day break, and the shadows flee away, I will get me to the mountain of myrrh, and to the hill of frankincense.
Thou*p art all fair, my love; there is no spot in thee.
Come*p with me from Lebanon, my spouse, with me from Lebanon: look from the top of Amana, from the top of Senir and Hermon, from the lions' dens, from the mountains of the leopards.
Thou*p hast ravished my heart, my sister, my spouse; thou hast ravished my heart with one of thine eyes, with one chain of thy neck.
How*p fair is thy love, my sister, my spouse! how much better is thy love than wine! and the smell of thine ointments than all spices!
Thy*p lips, O my spouse, drop as the honeycomb: honey and milk are under thy tongue; and the smell of thy garments is like the smell of Lebanon.
A*p garden inclosed is my sister, my spouse; a spring shut up, a fountain sealed.
Thy*p plants are an orchard of pomegranates, with pleasant fruits; camphire, with spikenard,
Spikenard*p and saffron; calamus and cinnamon, with all trees of frankincense; myrrh and aloes, with all the chief spices:
A*p fountain of gardens, a well of living waters, and streams from Lebanon.
Awake,*p O north wind; and come, thou south; blow upon my garden, that the spices thereof may flow out. Let my beloved come into his garden, and eat his pleasant fruits.
